intro: Didymocarpus puhoatensis, commonly known as the Puhoatensis mangosteen, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Myristicaceae and is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and fragrant flowers. The plant produces edible fruits with a segmented, juicy pulp, similar to the common mangosteen. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
